bibliographic_metadata.Title: Mineral Prospectivity Modeling of Graphite Deposits and Occurrences in Canada
Author: Steven E. Zhang
Christopher J. M. Lawley
Julie E. Bourdeau
Mohammad Parsa
Renato Cumani
Aaron Thompson

abstract: Exploration for graphite in Canada is of economic, strategic and governance priority. This study aimed to develop a reliable prospectivity map for graphite in Canada, mitigating multiple sources of workflow-induced uncertainty. By averaging an ensemble of de-correlated models, a consensus map and an uncertainty map were produced. The MPM products showed excellent spatial variability, aligning with existing knowledge of graphite deposits in Canada, indicating that combining data-driven rigor with independent interpretation enhances robustness.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > tree-based > gradient boosting (GBDT); supervised > tree-based > decision tree (CART); supervised > neural networks > feedforward neural network (MLP); supervised > kernel-based > support vector machine
key_points: Developed a prospectivity map for graphite in Canada.
Mitigated workflow-induced uncertainty through ensemble modeling.
Produced consensus and uncertainty maps for intuitive use.
Demonstrated robustness of MPM products aligning with existing geological knowledge.
Identified high prospectivity zones for future exploration.
